intro: Sida betulina, commonly known as the buckthorn sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, with five petals that are often pink or white in color. Sida betulina produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds.
